page.title: 13Free Churches-Whiteparish
page.content: The number of Free Church chapels in the village has decreased from 3 to 1 in the last 60 yrs.{A Primitive {Methodist}chapel in Clay Street closed in 1932 & a dwelling on the South of the school was once a meeting place for the{Plymouth Brethren.}The {Wesleyan Methodist}chapel in Dean Lane dates from 1859 succeeding another, site unknown. Services-twice each Sunday-led by a local preacher (av.Attendance-10). Sunday School - 9.45. Women's Bright Hour -twice monthly. Intercession group-once monthly. Bible study-weekly in Autumn & Winter in a member's home. This group, though small, has great potential - from them has emanated the Friendship Club for Senior Citizens & a committee to raise money for Christian Aid, & three members are local preachers.
